title: Gagné’s Nine-Event Instructional Design for Educational Software Development

context.prior_knowledge: Basic programming concepts and logical thinking skills
context.additional_context: Developing educational software development competencies to strengthen science education

learning_goals: Students can design three or more learning objectives for educational software based on Gagné's Nine Events of Instruction theory
Students can develop at least one simple educational software using authoring tools accessible to non-programmers
Students can analyze mobile-optimized microlearning content structures and apply them to real-world projects

resources: Educational Authoring Tools (MIT App Inventor or Scratch)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
